description: Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2 (Approved Plans) and condition 4 (Construction Management Plan) pursuant to planning permission 173101FUL granted on Appeal, dated 02/10/2018 for: 'Construction of detached residential dwelling house to the rear of No.33; including associated parking space, amenity space, refuse and cycle storage'. Amendments sought include a minor change in height, amendments to the front, side and rear fenestration, amendments to the roof profile of the single storey rear projection and amendments to the wording of condition 4.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of Planning Permission Reference APP/A5270/W/18/3198965, dated 02/10/2018.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and documents: 1311-P/P2/01 Rev 01 - Proposed Site & Ground Floor Plans Minor Amendment; 1311/P/ P2 /06 Rev 01 - Proposed Roof / Site, Basement and First Floor Plans Minor Amendment; 1311-P-P2-03 Rev 01 - Proposed Street Scene Elevation & Front, Side & Rear Elevations; 1311-P/P2/05 Rev 01 - Proposed Street Scene Elevation Showing Materiality Minor Amendment; 1311/WD/05 Rev 01 - Proposed Section A-A; 1311/WD/08 Rev 01 - Proposed Section D-D
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| The external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall be constructed in the materials specified on the application form and the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.10, and policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Construction Management Plan (dated 2 February 2021) and Addendum Letter (received 8 February 2023) prepared by Solstice of London, throughout the construction period for the development.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policy T7 and SI1 of the London Plan(2021); and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until refuse storage facilities have been constructed in accordance with details shown on approved plan no. 1311-P/P2/01 Rev 01. These facilities shall be retained at all times thereafter.

Reason: To ensure sufficient provision for refuse and recycling is provided to future occupiers of the site and to protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 7A and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies SI7, SI8 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until space has been laid out within the site in accordance with drawing no. 1311-P/P2/01 Rev 01 for 2 bicycles to be parked and that space shall thereafter be kept available for the parking of bicycles.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
